pacman.game.controller

Class InputController

  • java.lang.Object
    • pacman.game.controller.InputController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor

    public class InputController
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
    This class is responsible for the creation of the Input Controller. The controller reads inputs form the keyboard, touchscreen and accelerometer (If available).

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void accelUpdate()
      When called, this function reads the accelerometer X and Y inputs and applies the correct movement variable (up || down || left || right).

      When called, reset the current movement, making the player stop moving.

      When the screen is touched, the movement is reset making the player stop.
      boolean touchDragged(int screenX, int screenY, int pointer)
      When the screen is touched and dragged the movement variables will be updated to move the player on the dragged direction.

    • Method Detail

      • accelUpdate

        public void accelUpdate()
        When called, this function reads the accelerometer X and Y inputs and applies the correct movement variable (up || down || left || right).

      • resetMove

        public void resetMove()
        When called, reset the current movement, making the player stop moving.

      • keyDown

        public boolean keyDown(int keycode)
        Processes the given keycode, translating it into a movement variable. (W to up || S to down || A to left || D to right).
        Specified by:
        keyDown in interface com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
        Parameters:
        keycode - the key pressed on the keyboards.
        Returns:
        returns true if a required key was pressed.

      • keyUp

        public boolean keyUp(int keycode)
        Processes the given keycode, translating it into stopping a movement direction. (W to up || S to down || A to left || D to right).
        Specified by:
        keyUp in interface com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
        Parameters:
        keycode - the key released on the keyboards.
        Returns:
        returns true if a required key was released.

      • keyTyped

        public boolean keyTyped(char character)
        Specified by:
        keyTyped in interface com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor

      • touchDown

        public boolean touchDown(int screenX,
                         int screenY,
                         int pointer,
                         int button)
        When the screen is touched, the movement is reset making the player stop.
        Specified by:
        touchDown in interface com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
        Parameters:
        screenX - X coordinate of where the screen was touched. - Unused.
        screenY - Y coordinate of where the screen was touched. - Unused.
        pointer -
        button -
        Returns:

      • touchDragged

        public boolean touchDragged(int screenX,
                            int screenY,
                            int pointer)
        When the screen is touched and dragged the movement variables will be updated to move the player on the dragged direction. To do this, it stores a X and Y buffer and compares it to the current dragged X and Y.
        Specified by:
        touchDragged in interface com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
        Parameters:
        screenX -
        screenY -
        pointer -
        Returns:
